content: Would anyone on @t-libs or libs-impl be interested in joining maintenance of the libc crate? There are very few reviewers at the moment, and it could use more. It's usually relatively simple, it uses bors, and it has extensive CI to help catch target-specific issues.
@Josh Triplett yes.
@Mara Awesome, thank you.
@Josh Triplett it also uses high-five?
Yes. Currently preparing a patch for the team repo to add you.
https://github.com/rust-lang/team/pull/549
(nevermind, you already acked)
Thanks again! It'll be really helpful to have more reviewers in more time zones.
are you also updating high-five? that's separate, right?
I'm not familiar with the highfive update process.
Ah, found it.
i think you can also list teams there instead of individuals
not sure
hm, no
Would be nice if you could, yeah.
On that note...
@Amanieu You're currently on the libc highfive rotation. Would you be interested in joining the libc maintenance team as well?
Sure.
@Mara https://github.com/rust-lang/highfive/pull/314
@Josh Triplett oh you're not in there yourself?
Yeah, I noticed that when I went to add you. Not sure why not. :)
/me does manually review various libc PRs.
@Amanieu https://github.com/rust-lang/team/pull/549
And thank you!
@Amanieu Can you ack the team PR, please?
Added the libc team to the crates (libc and libc-test) as a crate owner on crates.io
I'll write up some docs for the release process later :)

@Josh Triplett btw, could I be part of the libs-reviewers? I've maintained libc for a while and sometimes have been requested reviews for libc related things on rust-lang/rust but I cannot r+ as I'm not part of the reviewers. It will help not to stop PRs :)

Yuki Okushi said:

I'll write up some docs for the release process later :)

I wonder how complex it would be to make it possible to @bors publish a crate...

Yuki Okushi said:

Josh Triplett btw, could I be part of the libs-reviewers? I've maintained libc for a while and sometimes have been requested reviews for libc related things on rust-lang/rust but I cannot r+ as I'm not part of the reviewers. It will help not to stop PRs :)

While I'm part of the libs team, I'm relatively new, and I'd prefer to leave that call to others. cc @T-libs

Josh Triplett said:

Yuki Okushi said:

I'll write up some docs for the release process later :)

I wonder how complex it would be to make it possible to @bors publish a crate...

we should also add a tag and publish libc-test, I think it should be documented for further reviewers :)
I didn't actually realize the libc-test crate was published.
context: https://github.com/rust-lang/libc/issues/2065
(I'm glad that it is, I just didn't realize.)
Thank you for taking care of that, and sorry to have missed it.
no worries! thanks for making a new release, too :)

@Yuki Okushi

could I be part of the libs-reviewers? I've maintained libc for a while and sometimes have been requested reviews for libc related things on rust-lang/rust but I cannot r+ as I'm not part of the reviewers.

fine with me. but you already have r+ rights on rust-lang/rust, right?
right, but it's not for reviews but rollups so I _think_ I shouldn't r+ actual PRs unless I'm a reviewer
ah sure. will send a PR.
thanks!
